tweets.text:
#Floodaware #StormAlex

Clearing debris from rivers, like here in the #RiveDitch [correct] near #Byfleet, outside the #M25...

... drops water levels significantly... 1/2 https://t.co/auFkBEnTKm

Flood warning issued for Masham, North Yorkshire. Levels on Swinney Beck have risen due to heavy rain. Expected to peak early Sunday. Do not walk or drive through fast moving water. Keep up-to-date and sign up to flood warnings at https://t.co/xADRoYzivA #StormAlex https://t.co/d0ihH498xZ

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - thanks to CEV Sarah with the last report of today at 21:00hrs. River level 26.85m AOD and rising. Barriers & EA onsite team all fine for the night shift with lots of capacity left in the river. @EnvAgencySW @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireRoads https://t.co/WRh3ECJQAf

@MarthaCrockatt @Westoxongreens @Earthwatch_Eur @thameswater @EnvAgency @UK_CEH Thirdly, we continue to work with @WildOxfordshire to ensure that @thameswater understand what is needed to deliver on their promise of a “Smarter Water Catchment” for the Evenlode.

urls.title: Dealing with extreme weather - West Sussex County Council
urls.description: Information and advice about dealing with flooding, heatwave, snow and ice.

tweets.text: A Flood Alert has been issued by @EnvAgency: https://t.co/oKan8GHfvi for the Rivers Eden & Eden Brook, for 4th Oct. Please take care of yourself, family and neighbours, especially if vulnerable. See the WSCC website for advice on keeping safe and well: https://t.co/VavpJBpdfH https://t.co/vKAydoJBUE

@MarthaCrockatt @Westoxongreens @Earthwatch_Eur @thameswater @EnvAgency @UK_CEH Secondly, we have been able to use the process to identify areas where volunteer groups are working hard to improve things. We are desperate to support these groups with further monitoring tools so we are seeking funding to do just that.

@MarthaCrockatt @Westoxongreens @Earthwatch_Eur @thameswater We have lots of plans!

Firstly, the data and findings will be shared with the @EnvAgency, who will use it to inform their work. Keep an eye on our webpage - we will soon be releasing some maps showing how the two datasets work together, thanks to our friends at @UK_CEH...
@Westoxongreens @Earthwatch_Eur @thameswater @FreshwaterIzzy any thoughts on this...?
The @EnvAgency's report into the environmental performance of water companies is released today. You can read the press release, my foreword and the full report here:  https://t.co/mwr4EUcpjm

tweets.text:
A #flood alert has been issued for the River Bollin catchment including #Knutsford #Wilmslow #Macclesfield & #Bollington. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring river levels & will issue further warnings if necessary. 
￼
Check your risk ➡️ https://t.co/aL4XRtmV9i https://t.co/oehdSx2aLk

Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/DvPy25LSuh

🌧️ River levels are rising on the River Wansbeck at the Morpeth river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall from Storm Alex. @EnvAgency are monitoring river level forecasts closely.

For the latest head to > https://t.co/c4LYR8M84H

#FloodAlert https://t.co/bJ0vU3fCDv

Great to see our River Don clean up item in West Boldon hitting the headlines in the @SunderlandEcho when two @EnvAgency field operation officers prepared for the expected bad weather from #StormAlex piece by Tony Gillan / story https://t.co/4CY5MMX0ii #SouthTyneside #Floodaware https://t.co/XIlyXnYYDK

tweets.text:
Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE

Looking forward to chairing @LivingWithH2O Board today. Climate change is very real for us and we are fortunate to have a unique partnership approach delivering results @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE j https://t.co/LqEUsA6bDn

domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

tweets.text: Assisting @EnvAgencySW field team with building the barriers today. A precaution against high river levels expected tonight. We are monitoring levels and barriers. #volunteers #partnershipworking @WiltsPrepared @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireRoads @BoATownCouncil https://t.co/uQLFoZuHKM

A number of #flood alerts are in place across the #NorthWest this evening. Our field teams have been out ensuring watercourses are free of blockages like here at County road #Ormskirk. Make sure you #PrepareActSurvive & sign up to flood warnings ➡️ https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/8VBI24E4ik

It’s not just #sewage that is killing #rivers it’s poor land management too. This is the Glottenham Stream in the #HighWeald #AONB with a heavy burden of #soil run-off after a moderate amount of rain. @EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexWildlife @highweald https://t.co/TmSH18z4r8

🌧️ River levels are rising on the River Wansbeck at the Morpeth river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall from Storm Alex. @EnvAgency are monitoring river level forecasts closely.

For the latest head to > https://t.co/rwRxLL7S2h

#FloodAlert https://t.co/Sbp9QFEx78

2014 report & now worse 💀& those responsible @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @AnglianWater @AffinityWater @thameswater @YorkshireWater @NorthumbrianH2O  Pat yourselves on the back you have successfully killed our rivers 💩💀🐟 https://t.co/at29TQGJDk

@Feargal_Sharkey @sascampaigns @SouthernWater @EnvAgency @Ofwat This stinks 😷                           Their ‘penalties’ cost them less than the costs of being responsible and investing to get it sorted! EA know that and just carry on playing along collecting their pocket money and thinking they’ve fixed things.
On 03/10/20 at 06:00 the river level was 4.8mAOD. https://t.co/pHKn4ZESFn

Due to forecasted heavy rain we have deployed Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & erected temporary defences at Barons Quay. This has been done as a precautionary measure to protect the community from potential high river levels.

Check your #flood risk 👉https://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/F5TNr9XO7f

https://t.co/MZMk0CR6L9
#Prudhoe #Ovingham #Wylam #tynedale #Tynevalley #Bywell #Corbridge #Hexham https://t.co/5nbzopqoBm

@greenbeltsal @tveitdal @Feargal_Sharkey @FT @NorthumbrianH2O @10DowningStreet @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @RiverlevelsUK @CleanIlkley @stellastafford @ExplorerDale @GarsingtonSave @save_our_fields @saverimrose @greenarteries @ElaineCox11 @save_greenbelt @SunderlandUK Thanks @greenbeltsal And @ExplorerDale I truly believe they all think this will simply go away.

urls.title: River and sea levels in England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: And of course you can check out current #river levels, & in some places, forecast levels via https://t.co/pqBPl2nv8E. All thanks to @EnvAgencyNW measuring stations expertly maintained by @CumbriaRain @AndrewBoothEA & many others. #keyworkers 👏👏👏

Unsurprising given today’s 🌧 @EnvAgencyNW have now issued #flood alerts in parts of the #NW. This means we believe that roads & low lying land may #flood from rivers. May need to issue some more in the next few hrs. Pls use https://t.co/vKsRlwd9JU for latest info. #floodaware https://t.co/xt02UuUpYz

🚨 Flooding possible 🚨 

You’ll need this info if you’re in west or south-west London tonight or Sunday 👀⬇️...

... including #Putney, #Chiswick, #Mortlake or #Twickenham... 

Free alerts to your device or to check the latest when it suits: https://t.co/ECXeJErzWW #floodaware https://t.co/eja7KBl08v
